channel.title: Amazon CLI (V1) User Guide Updates
channel.description: A RSS feed containing the latest updates on https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/v1/userguide/.

item.title: Updated credential and authentication information.
item.description: Updated credential and authentication method instructions and examples. This includes updating relevant configuration pages. To accommodate this increase in documentation, relevant credential topics were moved to the new Authentication and access credentials section.

item.title: Content for the AWS CLI V1 and V2 are now separated into their respective guides
item.description: For clarity and ease, the AWS CLI version 1 and AWS CLI version 2 content is now separated into their own guides. For AWS CLI version 2, see the latest AWS Command Line Interface User Guide

item.title: Added AWS CLI alias information
item.description: Added AWS CLI alias information. Aliases are shortcuts you can create in the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) to shorten commands or scripts that you frequently use.

item.title: Updated filter output information
item.description: Updated information for filters and moved to their own page.

item.title: Deprecation announcement for Python 2.7, 3.4, and 3.5
item.description: Python 2.7 was deprecated by the Python Software Foundation on January 1, 2020. Going forward, customers using the AWS CLI version 1 should transition to using Python 3, with a minimum of Python 3.6. Python 2.7 support is deprecated for new versions of the AWS CLI version 1 starting 7/19/2021. Python 3.4 and 3.5 is deprecated starting 2/1/2021.

item.title: Added Amazon S3 scripting example
item.description: Added an Amazon S3 lifecycle scripting example.

item.title: Added Amazon EC2 scripting example
item.description: Added an Amazon EC2 instance type scripting example.

item.title: Added retries information
item.description: Added a retries page for features and behavior of retries in the AWS CLI.

item.title: Server-side and client-side pagination page
item.description: Updated pagination information and centralized on a single page.

item.title: Updated s3 commands page
item.description: Updated the high-level s3 commands page with new examples and resources.

item.title: Updated installation information
item.description: The install, update, and uninstall information for Linux, macOS, and Windows are updated.

item.title: Updated to remove support for Python 2.6 and 3.3 from AWS CLI version 1
item.description: As of January 10th, 2020, AWS CLI version 1 no longer supports using Python versions 2.6 or 3.3. You must update to a newer version of Python to use AWS CLI version 1.17 or later.

item.title: New MFA section
item.description: Added a new section describing how to access the CLI using multi-factor authentication and roles.

item.title: Update to "Using the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the usage instructions and procedures.

item.title: Update to "Installing the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the AWS CLI installation instructions and procedures.

item.title: Update to "Configuring the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the AWS CLI configuration instructions and procedures.
